alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 7:02PM CDT until July 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTY... At 702 PM CDT, Heavy rain recently occurred across the warned area. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Light rain will continue for a couple more hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Cherokee County Emergency Management reported water over County Road 29 near Bulse Creek. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Forney, Pleasant Gap, Eastern Weiss Lake and Spring Garden. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
